subject: Back to work
author: Frank Sumption
full_text:
Winter vacation over! Not really a vacation, but the school district closes 
down for the holidays, plus the added snow days!! I have the two proto types 
boards complete, and funtional, at least as far as the individual sections 
go, now to test them in sessions. I must be getting older, cuz this stuff 
seems to take me forever anymore.  I kept the shortwave converter, and I 
think I have a version that works better. I think I'll order three more of 
the micro boards, and combine those with home made radios to get some more 
systems put together quicker.  I had three systems that I made using all 
surface mount components, and they were the most stable systems so far, and 
the most compact. I gave the first ones away, DOH!


Frank

>Christopher Moon <cold12_99@...> wrote:
>           The Winter 2006/2007 issue of Haunted Times Magazine is now 
>available
>in stores as well as in the mail for our loyal subscribers! Make sure
>to stop by the official Haunted Times Magazine web site:
>http://www.hauntedtimes.com to subscribe! In this issue we feature a
>story written by world renowned psychic Chip Coffee that delves into
>the murder of Rock legend John Lennon. Did demons play a major role
>in his untimely death? Pick up an issue of HTM and find out��� the
>answer may shock you! Haunted Times Magazine is always 84 full color
>glossy pages of pure paranormal information and evidence. Also, make
>sure to stop by the Haunted Times Magazine web site to view our free
>online winter issue. These are stories that are not featured in the
>print issue.
>
>The initial 2007 Ghost Hunter University schedule announced! Stop by:
>http://www.hauntedtimes.com to see just some of the great haunted
>locations throughout the world where you can be trained to become a
>paranormal investigator by Christopher Moon and the Haunted Times
>Magazine staff. Each event includes a ghost hunting seminar and
>interactive paranormal investigation of the property using real ghost
>hunting equipment��� some events even include a haunted history dinner!
>This is the only event that features the completed version of Thomas
>Edison's Telephone to the Dead where attendees can participate in
>real time two-way E.V.P. voice communication with spirits. The
>haunted properties include Waverly Hills Sanatorium, The Whaley
>House, The Hawthorne Hotel, The Lizzie Borden House, Ashmore Estates,
>The Mason House Inn and Eastern State Penitentiary just to name a
>few. Call toll-free: 1-877-880-6232 for tickets. Learn it and then
>live it at a Ghost Hunter University!
>
